Html:
First I want to say thanks for putting your effort into WPP which may be a huge help for some of us to manage 3rd party applications and don't have the $$$ for an expensive deployment solution.

I have installed WPP, it is configured, it has certs from the WSUS server and I have exported them to the GPO. I did not generate these certs from WPP. The original certs do show on the 2 PC's. I have 2 updates from the Adobe catalogs and I approved them for one group to test, a reader and flash update. I created the deadline 1 day before my actual time to force the install to go immediately, it is still listed as install and 0 installs for that group with 2 PC's in it.

What shoud I look for?

What is the status of the update in WPP : Not Applicable, Downloaded, Not Installed ?
On a PC, run the command WuAuClt /DetectNow, wait 1 minute and look at the C:\Windows\WindowsUpdate.log to see what happen.
  • Check that the certificate use by Wsus to sign package is correctly deployed on computers.
  • Check that the setting to trust non-Microsoft package is ok : HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WindowsUpdate\AcceptTrustedPublisherCerts = 1

David, I hope your English is better than my German! ;) Of these 3 detected updates, none are the Adobe installs, I appreciate your time and support.

Synchronization Windows Update Client successfully detected 3 updates.

1. What is the status of the update in WPP : Not Applicable, Downloaded, Not Installed ?

2. On a PC, run the command WuAuClt /DetectNow, wait 1 minute and look at the C:\Windows\WindowsUpdate.log to see what happen.

I have sent the logs to you

3. Check that the certificate use by Wsus to sign package is correctly deployed on computers.

4. Check that the setting to trust non-Microsoft package is ok : HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WindowsUpdate\AcceptTrustedPublisherCerts = 1

I could not find this one which led me to believe the GP was not being applied properly. As it was in a test group the GPO for WSUS was not applying and this key is not available.

After getting the GPO to apply the package is now in a not Applicable state. I’m not sure why. Adobe 9.4 is installed and I want to override this and update it.

Thanks,

Charlie

David, I also cannot determine where the package is to be downloaded from, where would I verify it has downloaded? Should I enable the WSUS clacification “Updates” to allow the Adobe Reader 11.0.04 Update?

Thanks,

Charlie

2013-09-17 11:26:24:086 1000 e28 Agent * WSUS server: <NULL>
2013-09-17 11:26:24:086 1000 e28 Agent * WSUS status server: <NULL>
2013-09-17 11:26:24:086 1000 e28 Agent * Target group: (Unassigned Computers)
Looks like you PC go to Microsoft Update, Not Wsus.
Check the whole Registry Key : HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WindowsUpdate
You should see the name of your Wsus server (in two value)
After getting the GPO to apply the package is now in a not Applicable state
What are "IsInstalled" and "IsInstallable" Rules ?
where would I verify it has downloaded?
Look at the WindowsUpdate Log file. You can also type WuAuClt /ReportNow to force your computer to report to Wsus.

It is now almost working! The install failed.

Certificate problem or GPO.
Check that certificate is in the right place and the Registry Key :
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WindowsUpdate\AcceptTrustedPublisherCerts = 1

OK, what to do IF WSUS is working and delivering updates and WPP is not?

Thanks,

Charlie

1. Check that the computer is in a group where your update is approved for installation.
  2. Check that the update is shown as "Not Installed" or "Downloaded" for this computer.
  3. Check in the WindowsUpdate Log on the computer if it detect that an update is available.
  4. If the computer detect the update, does it successfully download it ?

Due to the integration of Wsus Package Publisher I now have additional certs on my WSUS server and am unsure which ones are needed and am reluctant to delete any of them.

How can I tell which certificate is the one that should be used?
Go to Tools -> Certificate -> Export Cert and save it to local hard drive. Then open the Cert and look information (valid dates, serial number ...) and compare with other certs in the mmc.
